events.title: Unison Computing company founding
events.description: The Unison triumvirate unites! Paul, RÃºnar, and Arya found a company in Boston.

events.title: First alpha release of Unison
events.description: Unison calls for alpha testers for the first official release of the Unison language.

events.title: Strangeloop conference
events.description: The tech world gets an intro to Unison at the storied Strangeloop conference.

events.title: Unison Share's first deployment
events.description: Unison's own code hosting platform released. People can easily push code to their remote codebase and pull code from others to use locally.

events.title: Unison Forall conference
events.description: Our first community conference is an online affair featuring new libraries and topics from CRDT's to a peak ahead at the Cloud.

events.title: LSP support
events.description: The first appearance of the red-squiggly line for Unison appears in text editors.

events.title: Projects land in Unison
events.description: A stalwart few may remember that namespaces were initially our top-level project organization convention. We added the ability to segment your codebase into discrete projects, with branches for different work-streams.

events.title: Kind-checking lands for Unison
events.description: Since its introduction, Unison's kind-checking feature has prevented us from many headaches!

events.title: Contributions added to Unison Share
events.description: We added the ability to make pull-requests to Unison Share. Prior to this, users could `pull` and `merge` code once tagged informally in our Discord, but this added helping

events.title: OrderedTable storage added to the Cloud
events.description: `OrderedTable` added a user-friendly, typed transactional storage API to the Cloud. It was one of the first Cloud datatypes built atop *other* Cloud storage primitives; proving that storage could be compositional.

events.title: Unison Cloud generally available to the public
events.description: After much dogfooding and internal testing, we release the Unison Cloud to the general public! Folks deploy hello world in a few commands.

events.title: We open-source Unison Share
events.description: ðŸ«¶ Unison Share belongs to us all.

events.title: Ecosystem-wide type-based search
events.description: Discover projects, terms, and types across the entire ecosystem in a few keystrokes. Inspired by Hoogle and other type based code search solutions.

events.title: Unison Desktop App
events.description: Unison's Desktop app helps address the workflow challenge of not being able to "see" your codebase structure in a traditional way. It features click-through to definition functionality, and a rich, interactive UI.

events.title: Volturno distributed stream processing library
events.description: (timeline is not accurate but this is the earliest reference I could find to it) Volturno is a high scale streaming framework for Unison Cloud, with exactly-once processing and seamless, pain-free ops and management. Users can write distributed stream transformations in an easy, declarative API.

events.title: MCP server for Unison
events.description: Unison's tooling evolves to support AI coding workflows. Our MCP server is built into the codebase manager and supports AI agents taking actions like typechecking code, browsing docs, and inspecting library source code.

events.title: Cloud BYOC
events.description: We launched Unison Cloud BYOC - Unison Cloud can run on your own infrastructure anywhere you can launch containers.

events.title: UCM git-style diff tool support
events.description: We added a git-style code diff view integration. Set an environment variable and view PR's and merges in a familiar format.

events.title: Branch history comments
events.description: Your codebase is an append-only log of changes, and with the latest release of the UCM you can annotate your branch history with helpful descriptions for yourself or collaborators.
